column5: that frying pan pic made me hungry nice job
Great report!! Nice eyes!! I love seeing that!

Well myself and another OFC member cemilley,a.k.a ernie, decided for the long weekend we would head to my fav walleye spot...the ottawa river..we started at daybreak sat morning ,and the river was very low so we were off to find my honey hole..a really nice neck-down area with lots of structure and 2 deep 25ft holes in the current...and it didnt take long as were into some real nice sized walleyes,we also caught several smallies,and 1 pike,we fished all day sat and figured we nailed about 40fish,we kept several for an awesome shore lunch,and a few to take home,sunday morn back on the water at 5am...and we went right back to my spot and were into the fish again,when ernie hookes into a big channel cat,what a fight..as you can see by the pic he was a big 10lb plus.....we also went over to the quebec side and fished just above the rapids and man o man the walleyes were there too...we both got fish about 3lbs,and continued to hammer them there for a while,we hit a few more spots,caught another dozen fish and called it a weekend so we had an amazing time ate some walleyes,and caught lots of fish....so enjoy the scenery shots as the ottawa river is so amazing...almost all were caught on my homemade worm-harnesses,we did use a few cranbaitslike shad-raps,which was what the channel cat took,we couldnt believe it..as well as bottom bouncers ,and reef runners,.so enjoy. so after it all  we had a great time and the fishing was almost non-stop,so i cant wait till i go again
great job,love the scenery shots as well
I agree - especially the one in the frying pan!  -  They look sooooo yummy!  Good work!   Don
WTG bud, what an amazing couple of days!
Great report Shawn. That looks like a awesome weekend on the water. Thanks
A weekend of non stop fish action - sounds like a great couple days to me.  Congrats and thanks for the report.

You've got my boat! What do you think of the tiller lund with a 40hp 4 stroke? Do you now wish you were to upgrade to a 50 or 60hp? Where'd you buy it, what time of year, at a show, any discounts on it?  I haven't bought a new boat, but I'd like either a Lund tiller(too many models to pick from), or Crestliner 1650 FishHawk tiller or Princecraft Pro1650T.  I hope I can round up 15-20grand for it, in the next few years!
FD another fine report great pics and that stove looks like it has cooked thousands of walleyes.  MTP
Way to go Bud!I have always wanted to fisf the Ottawa River.Maybe next year.
niiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiice!!!!!   Gerritt.
the channel cat was a surprise for sure smashing a shap rap on a drop off

Shawn and Ernie....great job out there!  You boated more fish in that weekend than I have in the last year...LOL.  You guys sure know how to locate and catch em that's for sure.  If was good chatting with you the other day Shawn....we didn't catch anything that night...just have to keep on trying.  Talk to you later!
Nice pictures and some nice looking fish. If only I could catch one fish like those
very nice report. I have actually caught a few nice channel cats here on the ohio river using shad raps.
Santa Maria them's some fine looking eyes boyzs. I'd say you did real good.  TFS  Whopper
Awesome report!!!  Nice pickerel!!!
EXCELLENT report!!  Thanks for sharing!
nice report   you guys did great  love them walleye
Excellant Report!!! Sounds like a fishing trip and a half!! GPS co-ordinates please.
Where on the Ottawa river??  Ottawa   Arnprior,  Pembroke  ??????  Don't want the spot just general location.
Wow, that's a whole lotta pickerel.  Yummmmmyyyy.  Great job Shawn, great report and pics.  Way to go.  Joey
Looks like you had an awesome fishing trip!  Thanks for posting all that walleye eye candy!

Great report i wish i could catch Walleye like that! Ive yet to even land one hence my board name  but im trying need somone to show me some tricks oh well nice to see you got it down to a Tee WTG and great fish fry

I like the one handed hold , thats actually pretty impressive. Do you hit a special nerve with a finger or thumb that subdues them  lol I have trouble hangin on to them things for a pic with both hands  lol

Yes blaque,if you let them rest their belly in the cup of your hand ,in most cases they will laythere motionless for a little bit why o dont know but it works very well i have had them sit still for 20seconds,its kinda neat..thanks for asking    cheers
